title.narrative: SWE-2012-006: Collective Action and Community Development: Evidence from Self-Help Groups in India
SWE-2012-006: Collective Action and Community Development: Evidence from Self-Help Groups in India

description.narrative: 250 million rural Indians live on less than one dollar a day. Self-help groups (SHGs) aiming to empower women to accomplish collective objectives has received increased attention. India envisions mobilizing 150 million citizens into SHGs. However, there is little evidence as to their effectiveness. Our project uses a randomized-controlled trial (RCT): 32 villages in Rajasthan were randomly selected for the organization of SHGs, while 48 villages were selected as controls. The funds requested will support 3 initiatives: 1) A survey to gauge the long-term impact of SHGs. 2) Field experiments (public goods games) to study whether women in SHGs have adopted stronger norms of cooperation. 3) The creation of a Monitoring Information System by digitalizing log books from group meetings. Our analysis will have significant policy-implications for poverty-alleviation programs.

250 million rural Indians live on less than one dollar a day. Self-help groups (SHGs) aiming to empower women to accomplish collective objectives has received increased attention. India envisions mobilizing 150 million citizens into SHGs. However, there is little evidence as to their effectiveness. Our project uses a randomized-controlled trial (RCT): 32 villages in Rajasthan were randomly selected for the organization of SHGs, while 48 villages were selected as controls. The funds requested will support 3 initiatives: 1) A survey to gauge the long-term impact of SHGs. 2) Field experiments (public goods games) to study whether women in SHGs have adopted stronger norms of cooperation. 3) The creation of a Monitoring Information System by digitalizing log books from group meetings. Our analysis will have significant policy-implications for poverty-alleviation programs.
